author: T Madhavan
text:
The beginning of civil works for the third broad gauge line between Tambaram and Chengalpattu has revived hopes among commuters who want Southern Railway to expedite their terminal project here.

Construction of pit-lines started last year, but it has now slowed down, commuters have pointed out. With operations out of Central and Egmore stations nearly saturated, additional trains to the southern districts of Tamil Nadu could be operated only from Tambaram, they said.

It will also decongest the two stations, while making it possible to operate new trains to the rest of the country from there, said V. Rama Rao of Traffic and Transportation Forum.

Despite operating more electrical multiple unit services, they just do not seem to be enough to cater to the increasing number of commuters between Chennai Beach and Chengalpattu. Chromepet Rail Users Forum president V. Santhanam said: “We are very glad the foundation stone has been laid.

Though Railways’ time frame for completion of the project is 36 months, there might be certain delays and this should be minimum,” he said.

Every day, more than 250 trains are operated on this route, with most of them — 170 services — between Beach and Tambaram.

The 30-kilometre Tambaram-Chengalpattu third line will cost about Rs. 256 crore and help in operating EMUs and express trains without detentions anywhere on the way.

The work includes construction and extension of three major and 70 minor bridges.
title: ‘Speed up Tambaram terminal project’
